description: The double-fed cabling requires replacement to ensure the safety and continuous operation of the power distribution system. The new double-fed cabling will need to meet electrical codes and be CSA approved. The procurement contract is currently cancelled.
full_summary:
# Government Tender Announcement: Electrical Repair - Mountain Institution
### Electrical services
#### Request for Proposal
The Correctional Service of Canada is soliciting services for electrical repairs at the Mountain Institution. This requirement is subject to the Canadian Free Trade Agreement (CFTA) trade agreement.

### Contract Details
- **Contract Reference Number**: 21833-23-0169
- **Publication Date**: 2024-05-03
- **Tender Closing Date**: 2024-05-24T17:00:00 (Expired - Annulé)
- **Expected Contract Start Date**: None
- **Expected Contract End Date**: None

### Service Requirements
The contractor must replace the current copper feeder wiring between the Powerhouse and Kiosk SK-1 due to irregular tripping of the 400A 3Ph breaker. The new wiring must be CSA listed and ULC approved. The contractor must also provide a new bare copper bonding wire and verify the exact length required prior to ordering materials.

### Selection Criteria
The selection of the contractor will be based on the lowest price (Prix le plus bas).

### Business Requirements
- The contractor must submit a proposal outlining their approach to the project, including a thorough assessment of the site conditions and lock out procedures.
- The contractor must also provide professional liability insurance, a health and safety plan, and all necessary documentation.
- The contractor must conduct continuity and insulation tests on the new wires and submit a copy of the test reports upon completion.

### Maintenance and Operations
- The contractor must coordinate power shutdown and restoration with the institution, providing 96 hours’ notice before the power shutdown.
- The contractor must also clean and re-use existing underground conduits and clean up existing underground manholes.

### Additional Information
- Documents may be submitted in either English or French.
- Procurement Assistance Canada (PAC) offers seminars to businesses interested in learning how to sell goods and services to the Government of Canada.
- The full schedule of seminars can be found on the Buyandsell.gc.ca website, under Event Calendar (https://buyandsell.gc.ca/event-calendar). ## Rewritten Entry:
